Package com.Game.model

Class Player

java.lang.Object
com.Game.model.Player
public class Player extends Object
Represents a player in the game who owns territories and can issue orders. Players can deploy armies, acquire territories, manage their reinforcements, cards, conquered territories count, and negotiated players per turn.

  • Method Details

    • addTerritory

      public void addTerritory(Territory p_territory)
      Adds a territory to the player's owned territories.
      Parameters:
      p_territory - Territory to be added

    • removeTerritory

      public void removeTerritory(Territory p_territory)
      Removes a territory from the player's owned territories.
      Parameters:
      p_territory - Territory to be removed

    • createDeployOrder

      public boolean createDeployOrder(String p_targetTerritoryName, int p_numberOfArmies)
      Creates a deploy order based on the provided command parameters. This is an MVC-friendly version that doesn't depend on direct Scanner input.
      Parameters:
      p_targetTerritoryName - The name of the target territory
      p_numberOfArmies - The number of armies to deploy
      Returns:
      true if order creation was successful, false otherwise

    • validateBomb

      public boolean validateBomb(String[] p_parts, Map p_map)
      Validates a bomb command.

      This method checks if the bomb command has valid syntax, whether the target territory exists, if the player has a bomb card, and if the target territory is adjacent to any of the player's owned territories.

      Parameters:
      p_parts - An array of strings containing the command parts. The expected format is: [orderType, targetTerritoryName].
      p_map - The map containing the territories.
      Returns:
      true if the bomb command is valid, false otherwise.

    • validateBlockade

      public boolean validateBlockade(String[] p_parts)
      Validates a blockade command.

      This method checks if the blockade command has valid syntax, whether the target territory exists, and if the player has a blockade card.

      Parameters:
      p_parts - An array of strings containing the command parts. The expected format is: [orderType, targetTerritoryName].
      Returns:
      true if the blockade command is valid, false otherwise.

    • validateAirlift

      public boolean validateAirlift(String[] p_parts, Map p_map)
      Validates an airlift command.

      This method checks if the airlift command has valid syntax, whether the source and destination territories exist, if the player has an airlift card, if the player owns the source territory, and if the player has enough armies to airlift.

      Parameters:
      p_parts - An array of strings containing the command parts. The expected format is: [orderType, fromTerritoryName, toTerritoryName, numberOfArmies].
      p_map - The map containing the territories.
      Returns:
      true if the airlift command is valid, false otherwise.

    • validateNegociate

      public boolean validateNegociate(String[] l_parts, List<Player> p_players)
      Validates a negotiate command.

      This method checks if the negotiate command has valid syntax, whether the target player exists, and if the player has a negotiate card.

      Parameters:
      l_parts - An array of strings containing the command parts. The expected format is: [orderType, targetPlayerName].
      p_players - A list of all players in the game.
      Returns:
      true if the negotiate command is valid, false otherwise.

    • issueOrder

      public boolean issueOrder(String p_command, Map p_map, List<Player> p_players)
      Issues an order based on the provided command. The Player acts as the Invoker in the Command pattern, creating concrete Command objects (Orders) and adding them to its list of orders.
      Parameters:
      p_command - The command string containing the order type and its parameters.
      p_map - The map containing the territories.
      p_players - A list of all players in the game.
      Returns:
      true if the order was successfully issued, false otherwise.

    • issueOrder

      public void issueOrder()
      Prompts the user to issue an order.

      This method repeatedly prompts the user to enter a deploy order until a valid command is entered or the user finishes the process.

    • nextOrder

      public Order nextOrder()
      Retrieves the next order from the list of orders.

      This method returns and removes the first order from the list of orders.

      Returns:
      The next Order in the list, or null if no orders are available.

    • getNbrOfReinforcementArmies

      public int getNbrOfReinforcementArmies()
      Gets the number of reinforcement armies available for the player.
      Returns:
      The number of reinforcement armies.

      Sets the number of reinforcement armies available for the player.
      Parameters:
      p_nbrOfReinforcementArmies - The number of reinforcement armies to set.

      Parameters:
      p_ownedTerritories - A list of Territory objects to set as the owned territories.

    • getOrders

      public List<Order> getOrders()
      Gets the list of orders.
      Returns:
      A list of Order objects representing the orders.

    • setOrders

      public void setOrders(List<Order> p_orders)
      Sets the list of orders.
      Parameters:
      p_orders - A list of Order objects to set as the orders.

    • clearOrders

      public void clearOrders()
      Clears all the orders.

      This method removes all orders from the list of orders.

    • findTerritoryByName

      public Territory findTerritoryByName(String p_territoryName)
      Finds a territory by its name.
      Parameters:
      p_territoryName - The name of the territory to search for.
      Returns:
      The Territory object with the given name, or null if no such territory is found.

    • addCard

      public void addCard(CardType p_cardType)
      Adds a card of the specified type to the player's collection. If the card type already exists, increments its count.
      Parameters:
      p_cardType - The type of card to add.

    • removeCard

      public boolean removeCard(CardType p_cardType)
      Removes one card of the specified type from the player's collection. If the card count is greater than one, decrements the count. If the count is one, removes the card type from the collection.
      Parameters:
      p_cardType - The type of card to remove.
      Returns:
      true if the card was successfully removed, false if the card type was not found.

    • hasCard

      public boolean hasCard(CardType p_cardType)
      Checks if the player has a card of the specified type.
      Parameters:
      p_cardType - The type of card to check.
      Returns:
      true if the player has the card, false otherwise.

    • getFormattedCards

      public String getFormattedCards()
      Returns a formatted string of the player's cards. Example output: "BOMB: 1, AIRLIFT: 2"
      Returns:
      A formatted string.

    • getCards

      public HashMap<CardType,Integer> getCards()
      Retrieves the player's current collection of cards.
      Returns:
      A HashMap containing card types as keys and their respective counts as values.

    • getConqueredTerritoriesPerTurn

      public int getConqueredTerritoriesPerTurn()
      Gets the number of territories conquered by the player in the current turn.
      Returns:
      The number of conquered territories for the current turn.

    • incrementConqueredTerritoriesPerTurn

      public void incrementConqueredTerritoriesPerTurn()
      Increments the count of conquered territories for the current turn by one.

    • resetConqueredTerritoriesPerTurn

      public void resetConqueredTerritoriesPerTurn()
      Resets the count of conquered territories for the current turn to zero.

    • getNegociatedPlayersPerTurn

      public List<Player> getNegociatedPlayersPerTurn()
      Retrieves the list of players that the current player has negotiated with during the current turn.
      Returns:
      A list of players that have been negotiated with in the current turn.

    • setNegociatedPlayersPerTurn

      public void setNegociatedPlayersPerTurn(List<Player> p_negociatedPlayers)
      Sets the list of players that the current player has negotiated with during the current turn.
      Parameters:
      p_negociatedPlayers - A list of players that the current player has negotiated with.

    • resetNegociatedPlayersPerTurn

      public void resetNegociatedPlayersPerTurn()
      Resets the list of players that the current player has negotiated with, clearing all entries.

    • getHasConqueredThisTurn

      public boolean getHasConqueredThisTurn()
      Retrieves whether the player has conquered any territories during the current turn.
      Returns:
      true if the player has conquered territories this turn, false otherwise.

    • setHasConqueredThisTurn

      public void setHasConqueredThisTurn(boolean p_value)
      Sets the flag indicating whether the player has conquered territories during the current turn.
      Parameters:
      p_value - true if the player has conquered territories, false otherwise.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the player, including their name, number of reinforcement armies, and the number of conquered territories for the current turn.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string describing the player's current status.
